oIs9-ogevV9caBLidbsYmQ.text: I was starving. Absolutely, ravenously hungry. Sleeping in, I had left the house without breakfast, without even a cup of life giving coffee that I so desperately needed. This is a big no-no for me. If I don't have breakfast, the rest of my day is a shambles, guaranteed. I got off the train, took one look at the size of Costa's queue and walked off. I was on a mission to find somewhere, anywhere, that I wouldn't look daft dining alone in.  I'm never usually down by the Playhouse, but when I saw Taste of Italy I decided that it would do. It's a modern, fast-food style cafe and take-away place, which doesn't look much from the outside if I'm honest, but then I suppose that's what drew me in. Who wants to sit alone in a fancy eaterie? Table for one. Sadtimes.  The waitress greeted me at the door and took me to a table. She was very nice, much more attentive that I would expect from a cafe waitress. I had a look at the menu, and decided on a tomato and meatball panini and a latte. The seating arrangement is comfortable; the lower part of the cafe with the bar is next to very large windows with high seats and smaller tables, with some booths at the side which look really private. I was sitting at the upper part, with a widescreen tv on the wall which was showing Friends. Fantastic. The tables are white and the seats alternate between white, green, red and black, which I thought was a nice touch.   My brunch came, and I was super impressed with it. It wasn't just an average panini, the bread was soft on the inside and crusty on the outside, and stuffed full with tomato sauce and chopped meatballs, with stacks of cheese! It had a small side salad and some pink coloured mayo, but I don't like either (the salad was dressed in balsamic-boak!) The latte was in a huge mug, and was alright, definitely not the best I've had and I kind of expected more because this place is Italian.   The waitress asked me if everything was ok a couple of times, and as I said before, she really was lovely. It is table service, and my bill was brought to me. It was 6.20 for the panini and coffee, which I thought was great, as it really was one of the nicest paninis I have ever had!   I would definitely return, as I noticed a few things I would liked to have tried on the menu! They do pizzas, pastas, burgers and ice-cream among other things, and certainly beats an old greasy spoon!

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

tq06XgWKmZjDD8fQ2zQ7Sg.text: Would have been 5 stars if our waitress was a bit friendlier! my God not even a smile! even though other tables were luckier and they've got better waitresses!   Food was excellent! I saw dishes coming to th tables around and they looked amazing as well ( full scottish breakfast, pasta , calzone ,burgers and paninis)   we had the angus steak pizza and pollo milanaise , the pizza is excellent! the chicken was ok!   Huge portions btw so , good value for money!   we had two pieces of cake to go , and they were heavenly! we had the caramel profiterole cheesecake (heavy yet scrumptious), and double chocolate cake , not as good as the first but it was yummy too.   Quite busy and that's what i like to see in a place

RWhPamfLKpgnqSXyh1kzaA.text: Compared to some of the other takeaways and restaurants on Leith Walk, Taste of Italy catches your eye with its large, glass front and colourful sign.  Further, it's situated right around the corner from the Playhouse and so does a roaring trade both before and after shows.   I came here about two months ago and was impressed by how clean and fresh it is inside.  It feels like takeaway-come-cafe inside, but there is only table service which is provided by friendly and welcoming waitresses.  As the name suggests, virtually all the food is Italian, with plenty of different pizzas and pasta dishes to choose from, as well as burgers with chips.   I went for the penne al ragu which was pasta in a rich tomato and meat sauce.  It didn't seem to take long all to be prepared, was served in a generous portion.  My mate ordered their margherita pizza which looked like it had a thin, crispy base and a thick, cheesy topping.  Including drinks, we paid about 13 all together which seemed reasonable considering how good the food was.   Taste of Italy is certainly worth a look for a well-priced and tasty meal with good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

d_SxsLoO7sQngHAUSGAeYw.text: A hustling and bustling atmosphere at the lunchtime made it reassuringly popular. Service was efficient and menu choice was broad. However, I only give it 3 stars because the food was tasty but not particularly authentic. On the plus side the food was definitely on the cheaper side, so one can forgive this. A great budget eatery.

HF3loem1QpM1jQrkDrcbuw.text: This Italian cafe/restaurant is an absolute gem.   The first thing that I noticed was the open plan kitchen - something that I love - so you know your food's been prepared freshly. It's very much a cafe/diner with the bright colours and music playing on the tv and everything is exceptionally clean. The portions are surprisingly large especially considering the prices are low but of course, the taste is the most important thing. And WOW what a taste!! So far I've had a few pizzas, all of which were fantastic and the great thing is you can build your own with some of the extra toppings coming free. The risotto was also fantastic, but the best (if you have enough space left in your stomach) is the ice cream. I took the ice cream bowl for two with my girlfriend and it was just amazing, well worth the money.   Definitely a five star for Taste of Italy!

uZ6MdPoCXavplvZ46xrPqg.text: One of the newest addition and member of Italian restaurants on Leith walk. it is a restaurant-cum-cafe-cum-takeaway and is strategically located on the corner of Baxter street and Leith walk, just a few metres down the Playhouse, which makes it an easy target for pre or post theatre meal option for theatre goiers. The owner, Tony Crolla, has followed his style from La Favorita and Vittorias. the food is delicious and the free wi-fi is an good extra to an afternoon coffee and cake or a quick snack. The glass house of Taste of Italy gives a sense of openness and warmth.

UHDGN_pTKJYwSZ1-52GrkQ.text: Bog standard but tasty Italian food served in a modern, dineresque environment. Portion sizes are substantial and you can mix ingredients to make your own pizza/pasta dish, and there's a decent if unimaginative selection. Service is friendly and speedy and most of the staff Italian. The perfect place to grab something to eat before the cinema round the corner. They do all their food to take out too, including a range of paninis and cakes-I've been disappointed with these though would definitely recommend the restaurant if you're looking for a decent meal or snack on a budget. Pizzas especially are excellent value, and there's a good range of coffees and teas, including a gorgeous rooibush chai! Worth a try.

AA4ykA9gKBmXQlpl7tpAzg.text: Food is excellent. Tasty and great value. Service is brilliant too. The atmosphere is relaxed and could quite happily sit all day sampling the menu!

LkpEiF2aM_JkzihJTaXgvw.text: Food is excellent. Never once had a bad meal. It's owned by the same family as Vittorias.   Only thing I don't like about this place some of the waitresses seem to have an attitude problem. Some of them are very nice, none of them have ever offended me but some of them just look like they carry the same attitude as a make up girl in Harvey Nichols

3-0SvuUTphqkC2uULQbrOw.text: I have always loved Taste of Italy. Cheap and Cheerful...and a litre of Wine for 10. Sounds great!   This is definitely one of my go-to places for a quick filling tasty meal, despite having my phone nicked from there a year ago. That was a bummer.  I've never had a meal i didn't like from here, the pizza has a nice thin Italian type crust, and the toppings are always fresh. The pasta is all very delicious, I've always enjoyed the penne carbonara (I think that's what it's called). Yummy Italian sausage and penne tossed in garlic and olive oil. Nom. I do feel perhaps they've changed the recipe since re-opening...but it's been a fair few months since the last time I had this.   The wait staff are always incredibly friendly and welcoming. I've always had excellent service.   Now for the most important bit...the wines. A litre of house red is both delicious and cheap-ish. It used to be 10 but with the recent refurb it seems to have gone up to 11.95 or some such. Either way between two people a meal is still only 10-12 each. That alone makes this one of my favourite places to eat and chat away to fabulous people.   They also have the most gorgeous looking cakes. So far my favourite is the carrot cakes....delightful. Just mind your level of hunger as the portions are GINORMOUS! You probably will not get through both a main and a cake. So choose wisely my friend.   All in all, if you haven't had a meal here yet I strongly recommend you do. You will not be disappointed. It's perfect for anyone who enjoyed pasta, pizza, wines and cakes!!

FXePuow_WYyZaMu3XgcniQ.text: Once I was passing and went in for a quick slice of pizza and a delicious strawberry milkshake. I thought it was really nice so I went again last week and waited on a margarita pizza to take away. When I came home I was all excited to have it as I was starving till I opened my pizza to see the extra tomato on top wasn't even cooked and the pizza was all oily. I won't be getting a pizza again but I'll definitely be getting their milkshakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

mAHTNQZpdGEEPcFUGpGSXA.text: As previous review has said, this place is more of a cafe than a restaurant. It's not the place for a candlelight romantic Italian meal. That said, this IS a fabulous place for GREAT Italian meal, snack or coffee.  The menu is full of tasty pizzas, pastas and other Italian favourites. Service is quick and friendly. If you need to "grab and go", then there is a take out server as you enter the cafe.  Great food, fast service, good prices. Ideal for a breakfast, lunch or evening meal in the heart of Edinburgh's Playhouse district.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

eZueMJQlYUUIOIqiSo6Czg.text: This is a great wee place for a quick yummy authentic italian bite to eat. I go here loads and have never been disappointed. It's not fine dining, but it's not pretending to be and it certainly doesn't cost the same.   It's extremely good value and high quality. Service is good and quick, a perfect pre or post shopping trip place to fuel up. It is always busy but I've always been able to get  a table and the busyness has never affected service. I usually get the pasta and carafe of wine - great value. I was here last weekend for a quick re-fuel post shopping trip and had chicken and pesto panini washed down with a moretti, yummy.  I would definitely recommend if you're looking for quick, simple, good value, delicious and authentic Italian food. I will keep going back!

5atsnr9qediq09QCDjONEQ.text: Decent Italian style diner from the people who brought you Favorita and Vittorias.  Definitely cheap and cheerful with a wide ranging pasta, pizza, burger menu.  Also good for breakfast and lunch.  Very friendly attentive staff.

SssEyCvNQxKDTswu5pj77g.text: Really affordable, tasty Italian food. I came here with friends for a birthday celebration and enjoyed the bustling atmosphere and good service. My 14 inch pizza was incredibly tasty for a meagre 8 and I finished my meal off with a 4 toffee and banana sundae. Yum!

r9WdyMqKrX4fO_oAIfNfDQ.text: Interior wise this is more a Italian 'caf'. Not really a restaurant as such. That said I have to say that their food is very tasty and the portions are not too big. I don't mind the 'caf' look & feel as it is suited for my purposes. And do Italian places always have to be a restaurant?   I do treat my visits here more as a quick snack, for a nice chat over a good coffee or even just to gather my senses.  I like it. The staff is efficient and very helpful. The place is clean and the prices reasonable.  So it does exactly what you expect it to do - it serves Italian food that tastes good.

1LRuG1yVYzqKiIjyQFx-9Q.text: I've been here quite a few times and have had a nice time.   Tonight however I've come away very very disappointed. We had hardly any interaction with the staff other than them taking orders and payment. I requested no parsley on my pasta as personally I can't stand it...my pasta arrives and of course it has parsley in it. I tried to make eye contact with a waitress to at least prompt her to come over and ask how we were enjoying our food, but no such luck and I really didn't want to cause a scene.  My boy friend had the mac and cheese, which was very dry and overly creamy, to the point it made him feel a bit sick.   So overall service was really bad and the food was not the best.

icixWOHiNYhZ7zFVSV3KAA.text: I had it on good authority this is one of the best Italians in Edinburgh. The 'authority' being a bunch of Italians.  What I'll say is: It's a nice place for a quick bite. It's set up like a diner and when I was here last week we were on raised chairs at the window which is probably the best spot for people watching. The waitress was absolutely charming and saw to us quickly.  I had the Hawaiin while across from me a burger was ordered. I was nearly fooled by the 'What a cheap burger!..Oh ...wait...'  the burger doesn't come with chips, they're ordered separately which brings the price up. When the food arrived it was delicious. The pizza was definitely up there with La Favorita in my books. The burger was demolished so I think it got the seal of approval!  After I decided I wanted tiramisu (basically I saw the word tiramisu and just had to have it!)  and honestly I was disappointed. Tiramisu, to me, is delicious thick creaminess with an ameretto bite. This was '2 for 1' at Iceland quality dessert.   Overall it was a nice, quick, casual meal and many people were watched! I'll be back as it's on the way home, the pizza is definitely up to scratch and apparently they do breakfast omelettes and The OH has his heart set on one.

iRj2wv0WlqA4xjQclikcHw.text: We were recommended Taste of Italy by a  family member and I'm glad he mentioned it. The place is small but the food is freshly prepared and delicious. The service is fast (possibly a bit abrupt ?) and there's not a lot of tables, but that appears to be the appeal of the place: good food, quickly and off you go.  If you want a nice relaxing or romantic  meal this probably isn't the place for you but if you want good food at a reasonable price (and, judging by the accents of the other patrons, I suspect more authentic than most Italian restaurants) you have to check it out.

PHqRKrYPjGbScR7lQhs9Vw.text: This is a brilliant cafe and probably my favourite eatery in Edinburgh. The service is always excellent - fast and friendly - and the food is great. The Vesuvio Pizza (with no chilli) is my personal favourite and probably the best pizza in Edinburgh. The pasta is also great and they do a fantastic Carbonara. I recently took my Italian friend from Napoli who has lived in Scotland for 7 years and he said it was the best pizza he has ate in Scotland - so that is saying something. The staff are lovely, non pretentious and it's fast and cheap, so a no brainer 5 star review in my opinion. If you haven't been you must go!

9-D1Ix3McomJwlTeTJaRVg.text: I wasn't sure if I could take this restaurant seriously, as I felt the modern building, as well as the name were quite dubious!  So I was pleasantly surprised when I finally went in last week. The first thing that hit me were the desserts. They've got a whooping large variety, and the presentation is so great I considered cleaning the counter out bank robbery style!   Taste of Italy (cringe!) has been open for just a few months, and it does indeed have that smell of fresh enterprise. The menu is extremely varied, and though I only grabbed a dessert to go (how can one resist a profiterole CAKE!) they also serve breakfast, pizzas, salads,pasta, paninis and burgers.   I suspect they're trying to stand out from the numerable Italian restaurants in the area, as there is something a bit younger and livelier about the colours and design of the place. Personally, I'm more of an old soul, but the food here is great. Did I also mention cheap?

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Mru6idz1NsSe1kkGvlwUvQ.text: I don't find a Taste of Italy to look as Italian as it may like, but if you're looking for a quickly whipped up satisfying pizza, then chow down on what this place has to offer.  Convenient and styled like a modern fast food establishment (with a few booths included so you can sit in) A Taste of Italy is a pretty tasty option if you're looking for takeaway in a hurry. It pulls a lot of its business in from the neighbouring Playhouse, and from people making their way to and from work.  Interestingly, this place is owned by the man who is behind the absolutely delicious Vittoria restaurants. It's proof you shouldn't judge a book by its cover since I find the exterior to look more takeaway than culinery delights. But I appreciate that Crolla is attempting to move in a different direction, and it opens up his highly acclaimed business enterprise to another audience. This platform does the job nicely - all the quality of the Vittoria's cooking but lower prices and a different pace of service.   If I stayed within a mile of this place, I would happily become obese. But considering I don't, I satisfy my cravings when I'm through at the theatre. Bella, bella!

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Qfrrwc7L-MJM-ri2w6MIkQ.text: From the same stable as Vittoria, La Favorita, and Divino Enoteca, diner-style Italian, Taste of Italy, offers good quality at high speed. If you're looking for a fast bite, this place is ideal.  Overall, we said: "Taste of Italy serves high quality dishes, quickly and efficiently, at a very reasonable cost. It keeps things simple, focuses on flavour, and has a bunch of happy customers, as a result. It's a great spot for a quick, high-value bite, so I'd happily recommend that you pay it a visit, soon."

7mKkdUsPtjkTSJX0GvIvWA.text: Want food without having to reserve a table at a fancy restaurant and bypassing the expensive prices of the city centre without having to travel too far away?    This little casual dining cafe is a great spot for fast food without having to resort to McDonald's or Burger King.    Great anytime of day whether it be poached eggs and smoken salmon (delish, just what the hangover ordered!!!) for breakfast, panini for lunch, afternoon coffee and cake or even burgers for dinner - this place offers it all!!!    Meet the girls for Saturday brunch before hitting the shops, catch up on the gossip from the previous night's adventures or grab some food here before heading to the cinema.  For any occassion this place is a winner.

ERIsm8qpqZRjffa62JL_uA.text: Fast in, fast out, not really cheap, but not particularly expensive, decent Italian food.  Here for lunch. Had Tagliatelle al Pollo, which was nice, but not fabulous. At 5.95, perhaps a bit wee and a bit dear, but I just couldn't be bothered with a sandwich. It was nice, but in hte "something you could throw together at home for about a quid" kind of nice.  It is quick, central, and with attentive staff. Feels like a chain-- not sure if it is.  Good, but not fantastic, coffee...

e0zF1EsEmBAuwPb-IFRj9g.text: I'm baffled to find that this place is apparently new. I could have sworn it was here years ago.  Despite then proving evidence of my increasingly deluded and hallucinatory behaviour, Taste of Italy still impressed enough on my sole visit to be firmly on my radar next time I'm down this end. Sadly that's all too rare an occasion, as despite it being my favourite part of Edinburgh duty rarely takes me here.  My cappuccino was creamy, frothy to the bottom, and generally just pretty fantastic. The dark chocolate shavings instead of the usual powdered gunk was a further Brucie Bonus. The ciabatta with creamy mozzarella, and bursting with big meaty tomatoes, was also as faultless as you could ask for.  Fingers crossed I'm back down this end of town soon.

sz0_CXIjL7v3ChowSBmSWQ.text: Very nice to sit here eating a margherita and a slice of cake. You can either sit on the back or up in the front and look outside and that particularly suits you if you're by yourself as I was the other night! The prices are not bad and some of the waitresses are Italian which makes it feel even more authentic given that the pizza itself is not bad at all!

6i4XxSWhpTZK9Rz33ww2IQ.text: Went with my wife and my mother-in-law, who is gluten intolerant.  Taste of Italy has gluten-free pasta, which means it is ideal for those who are gluten intolerant.  I had the Calzone, which was enormous, and stuffed with pepperoni, ham, mozzarella, and home-made tomato sauce.  It was delicious, especially the tomato sauce, which tasted fresh and flavoursome.  My wife had carbonara, which I though was a little cheesy, considering it is supposed to be only eggs in the sauce, but it was ok though.  My mother-in-law had Salmon pasta, and she thoroughly enjoyed it.  The restaurant is a little loud, due to the low ceiling, but the interior decor is clean and modern.  It is somewhere between a cafe and a restaurant, but for the prices, I think it is very good value.  I will certainly be going again.

spCcNA64zDv-KNRjATdddg.text: Quick, cheap and convenient! This little place was right around the corner from our hotel in Edinburgh and I think we ended up here three times in two days.  They're open early for breakfast and have great coffee and breakfast rolls. They also stay open late (until 11pm) - the pasta, pizza and paninis are very delicious and they do serve beer, wine and a limited selection of hard alcohol.  Service is prompt and friendly! I'm glad this restaurant isn't next to my house because I'm sure I'd gain 20lbs in no time. :)

BjMhXFDWYAmR5XZkvWA81Q.text: We wanted to be near the action in Edinburgh but not too close so we walk to and fro from our hotel and the activities.  While walking Bruce noticed this Italian restaurant was always busy so we decided to try for dinner. Though they do make what looked like good pizza it was pasta we ordered; that's after a nice green salad-mine with arugula and Bruce was mixed green-nice size. The meals-penne with Italian sausage and mine- spaghetti carbonara. Both were excellent-rich and tasty! Plenty to eat but not a ridiculous amount. The manager/owner (?) was attentive and pleased we liked our meals. We will be back since they are open breakfast, lunch and dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Penne with sausage
Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Spaghetti carbonara

IihkdUo7N69-XuHxtsb03g.text: The food is fabulous and the prices were good. All fresh ingredients- my husbands meal contained three different kinds of fresh mushrooms.  My pasta was excellent.  The ambiance and the service were lacking. We would love to combine the food from here to the service across the street.

ghhTWMLRsf5viqPSjcgseA.text: We ordered a fried mozzarella and a meat lasagna. The food was ok it was a nice meal for a cold day.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

hnQU-6eHnFeGFiM1a0UCtQ.text: This was a great find with great tasting fresh food at an incredibly reasonable price. The food was very high quality and was better than some of the other fine dining Italian restaurants in the area and came in large portions. In a diner-style setting it is quite comfortable with very attentive waiters and we did not have to wait long at all to be seated or be provided service, even though it was a busy Friday night. I would definitely recommend the "ravioli taste" (ricotta & spinach ravioli in a creamy sauce of porcini mushrooms)!

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The &#34;Ravioli Taste&#34; (ricotta &amp; spinach ravioli in a creamy sauce of porcini mushrooms) - a must try!
Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ravioli taste (ricotta &amp; spinach ravioli in a creamy sauce of porcini mushrooms), garlic bread, quatro formaggi (4 cheese) pizza, pasta

YBV1PenetZJwZJzxAGrnjw.text: I adore this place.  It seems all I eat in the UK is Italian food. Cappuccinos are nothing unique but good quality and never disappointing. I like the meatballs and bruschetta as I try to control my carbs to some extent. The paninis and pizza are also quite good. For the price, you cannot beat it!  I was here 6 times in 3 days.  The staff are fantastic, and not hard to look at. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

edbmCX9nTqv26nFK6MISVQ.text: I'm not sure what we were expecting but we wanted a place for dessert and this was the only thing we could find close to our hotel.   On the plus side, server was accommodating to our group with friendly efficient service. The desserts themselves were solid with ice cream and other standbys fitting the bill.   But it's just an average place in a city with lots of choices. Choose wisely.

CVqAvgIqdnAUQcscabuEbg.text: This was a great find. They have good food at a reasonable price. three of us had pizza, my husband had the Mac & cheese & my daughter had a panini. Everyone was happy with their food. The quality was something you would normally find in a more expensive restaurant. I would give it 5 stars but it is in somewhat of a diner setting & it was kind of crowded & loud. We would definitely return.

W5s4pK4qkwRwE88HVTdZ1w.text: Out in Edinburgh on vacation with my wife and was staying at the Glasshouse Hotel nearby. We had a late lunch was and looking for a light dinner so we decided to check out this place.The decor fits the cafe scenery and it's clean. There are a few high tables when you walk in and more tables in the back. The cashiers are in the front and it's easy to order with the menu above the cashiers and paper menus all around. If all you want is dessert there is a separate window adjacent to the sidewalk and you don't have to walk in.  We ordered a 10" Margherita pizza, Spaghetti Aglio E Olio, and a strawberry cheesecake. Everything was good and I would recommend it.   Tip: This is a European thing but there are different prices between dining-in and carryout. Carryout has cheaper prices.

L9UKSK_axvoOj7unxF395w.text: Lots of people, and a really good vibe. The service was nice, and we didn't waited long before the meals came on the table. And oh my Lord...!!! It tasted like a piece of heaven! Perfect cooked pasta, nice spices. The best pasta dish I have ever eaten!   Greetings from Norway, and thank you for a perfect evening.

HOj2OXOnxkM-oVINIAcKtA.text: Ahhhh taste of Italy... A good place to go  for affordable, generous, and tasty bowl of pasta or pizza! This place as its name indicate serves Italian food. The menu has a very long list of pasta dishes as well as plenty choices of pizza and panini. The type of pasta dishes they serve for the most part are simple but flavourful dishes.  You find squid ink pasta here... But you can find a bowl of pasta with bolognese sauce or carbonara.  They also serve breakfast (not sure why they felt inclined to include Scottish breakfast) and cafe... Their latte is similar to what you'd get in Italy... FYI!   I ordered a vegetarian arancino (risotto bowl filled with cheese and spinach) and tagliatelle Delhi chef (tagliatelle noodles with a creamy bolognese sauce with pepperoni and mushrooms) the arancino was golden brown, crunchy and not mushy. You can see every risotto and was perfectly seasoned. It came with marinara sauce so it made it perfect! The only complaint I have with the dish is the cost cause 3.30 for that I think is a lot considering I can get that much cheaper when I'm in Italy... Another discussion!   The pasta dish I got was only 6.50 and came in a very generous portion. The pasta was richly flavoured due to the creamy bolognese sauce and had plenty pieces of pepperoni.   I didn't get any of the dessert because I wasn't in the mood for it, but they have the typical Italian desserts- tiramisu and gelato.   The restaurant has a diner feel to it, so people come and go. It gets pretty busy so expect to wait for a table during rush hour, but worth the wait if you want a big bowl of pasta and not break your piggy bank. The staff are pretty quick and sometimes they are too busy, but just grab one of them and they'll be happy to get whatever you need.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

A6DHERsrHDWeWfQcPGdYxQ.text: Stopped at Taste Of Italy while on a trip to Edinburgh. The sun was blazing (rare I know!) and after a full day of sightseeing we wanted to rest our weary legs and cool down. We stopped here as it was en route to our hotel, had outside seating and looked like a lovely clean, modern cafe. Service was quick and pleasant and the ice cream yummy. We choose three sundaes; raspberry & white chocolate, strawberry & meringue and salted butter caramel all 3.95 each. Absolute sweet deliciousness. We noticed that some people sitting outside were eating really scrumptious looking pizzas and drinking glasses of what looked like Italian beer. I fully intend to return to Taste Of Italy on my next trip to Edinburgh and sample the rest of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ice cream...
Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ice cream...
Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ice cream...

toZxIJAw36aqiL_VVpIhEA.text: Pretty good thin crust pizza.  Panini are quite good too - fresh bread and nice toppings.  Good salads which is a bit of a rarity in such a meat obsessed country.    It's open later - until 11:00 pm.  Found myself eating here more than once on my recent trip, mainly b/c it's right next to the office, and b/c the staff was friendly and the food was good.

jLQGet9tQKklR5ST0cL7zg.text: A really bright and busy cafe/restaurant. The service here is quick, the food cheap but delicious, the menu is HUGE, and the waitresses have great taste in lipstick! What more is there to say?   I have visited here several times now, and will keep going back. It is a great stop before a trip to the Playhouse or the cinema which are both seconds away. For me also, it is a very good place to go satisfy my hunger after a long session in the haberdashery at John Lewis.   They also have a stacked deli counter, and I often find myself picking up a little something extra, just in case I get hungry on the way home.

RX5UTsBTWNOwTPLv_-TW5g.text: Small and cosy restaurant with nice food and drinks menu .nice staff and music . Would return!

Rt0qDMJBmBbNE77XyIWTUw.text: Great reasonably priced food. Nice servers. Tourist friendly, close to the main hub, close to B&B's. Great wi-fi. Close to the theatre.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste of Italy - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lovely Lily

yRimcsOXaYgGoM-yw2NcFA.text: Taste of Italy yelp review Aug 8th 2014 -7:00 pm  Had another wonderful meal. Great genuine service. A sweet handsome man stood near my table and made me giggle. So I invited him to sit with me. So nice. The waitresses were great and I felt were looking out for me but I was fine.   The chef made me a smashing caesar salad minus the chicken as I requested and gave  me beautiful red peppers instead.   Such a great place. Wonderful atmosphere. Love the waiting staff, they seem to genuinely behaving fun. I think most are Italian. Had a grand sicilian waitress and I learned a little about Sicily!  Very Continent feeling.  Can't wait to go back. Oh. And great prices too.

OBM8pTO5--UIVEAp8Ulfig.text: Excellent for a basic Italian meal and a good choice for families or groups who want to eat for less near the city center. I've eaten there with my husband, with my grandparents, and with coworkers and found the restaurant to be appropriate for all groups. Even my boss, who is full Italian, is a fan of their basic but tasty pasta dishes. Their pasta dishes are generously portioned and they are accommodating to slight changes in your orders. The place can be a bit loud and is unlikely to have anything really unusual to stir up your taste buds, but is a perfect fit for comfort food. While we've usually been too full to order dessert, if you can pace yourself the gelato is well worth it!

-Mrhc4Ak5smuB9KrYjsEkA.text: Very good place to sit and a have a quick meal. I was here yesterday with two friends; they both had the mushroom risotto (declared excellent), and I had a panini. The panini was average, and the original panini that I requested was out of stock. :( There is wonderful outside seating, friendly staff, and a nice selection. I would recommend this place.

NxOlS4b4d-OSGdfDNvlp7A.text: Very good prices for the food. The food also tasted pretty good! I got essentially a three course meal for 12. Everything tasted good, the breadsticks, pasta, pizza, and their sundae. I would definitely recommend!
